assistant
Mutations in genes that encode proteins called dystroglycan (DTC) and tubulin 2A (TUBIN A), or at least one of these two, have been identified as a cause of myocentric dystonias. The DTC protein is involved in normal development of neurons by providing structural support for their cell membranes. It also plays an important role in transporting materials from the endoplasmic reticulum into the nucleus during early embryonic development. Mutations in the gene encoding TUBIN 1B lead to mutations in the DTC gene; this mutation results in reduced levels of the protein.

How to diagnose High Blood Pressure ?

assistant
Your doctor will use a blood pressure cuff and an automatic monitor. The cuff is worn on your arm, which you put in the airway of another person or yourself. You then wear the automatic monitor for 12-30 minutes at rest (without exercise) and during activity.
                
The device measures your blood pressure by detecting changes in how much blood flows into your arteries when you move from one position to another. It also records your readings as they change with time.
                
                
You can check if your blood pressures are normal after each test. If there's no abnormal reading, it means that your blood flow is normally controlled.

assistant
Treatment is supportive and aimed at improving quality of life. The goal is to maintain as much function as possible, avoid complications, and improve comfort.
                
People with progressive supranuclear palsy may need help with daily activities such as eating or dressing. Treatment should be individualized based on each person's needs.

Diabetes mellitus, or type 1 diabetes, occurs when the body's immune system attacks its own insulin-producing cells. Insulin helps regulate blood glucose levels by allowing sugar to be used for energy.
                
Type 2 diabetes, also called non-insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus (NIDDM), happens when people have too much fat in their bloodstream that can't be broken down into usable fuel. Fat builds up as a result of excess calories eaten over time. The body then uses it instead of using insulin to get rid of extra fat.
                
                
The main symptoms of both types are fatigue, weakness, and unexplained weight loss.
